component.description: ChibiOS/RT STM32F4xx low level drivice drivers files.

groups.name: STM32F4xx Settings
groups.description: STM32F4xx Low Level Drivers options and settings.

group.name: Initialization Settings
group.description: Generic initialization-related settings. Note that the validity of the following settings is performed at compile time. Changing the default values requires a careful reading of the STM32F4xx Reference Manual, especially the section regarding the RCC unit.

property.brief: Activating this options bypasses the whole clock initialization phase. All the following settings are ignored.
property.name: Do Not Init

property.brief: Enables or disables the HSI oscillator.
property.name: Enable HSI Oscillator

property.brief: Enables or disables the LSI oscillator.
property.name: Enable LSI Oscillator

property.brief: Enables or disables the HSE oscillator.
property.name: Enable HSE Oscillator

property.brief: Enables or disables the LSE oscillator.
property.name: Enable LSE Oscillator

property.brief: Select if the 48MHz internal clock is required. This clock is used by USB and SDIO.
property.name: Enable 48MHz Clock

property.brief: Clock source used by the system.
property.name: System Clock Source

property.brief: Clock source used to drive the PLL.
property.name: PLL Clock Source

property.brief: PLL "M" Divider, divides the input clock.
property.name: PLL M Input Divider

property.brief: PLL "N" Multiplier.
property.name: PLL N Multiplier

property.brief: PLL "P" Divider.
property.name: PLL P Divider

property.brief: PLL "Q" Divider.
property.name: PLL Q Divider

property.brief: AHB Divider.
property.name: AHB Divider

property.brief: APB1 Divider.
property.name: APB1 Divider

property.brief: APB2 Divider.
property.name: APB2 Divider

property.brief: Clock source used by the RTC.
property.name: RTC Clock Source

property.brief: RTC HSE divider value if the source is HSEDIV.
property.name: RTC HSE Divider

property.brief: Clock source used by the MCO1 output pin.
property.name: MCO1 Clock Source

property.brief: MCO1 Divider.
property.name: MCO1 Divider

property.brief: Clock source used by the MCO2 output pin.
property.name: MCO2 Clock Source

property.brief: MCO2 Divider.
property.name: MCO2 Divider

property.brief: I2S clock source.
property.name: I2S Clock Source

property.brief: I2S PLL "N" Multiplier.
property.name: I2S PLL N Multiplier

property.brief: I2S PLL "R" Divider.
property.name: I2S PLL R Divider

property.brief: Scalability level 1 is for maximum performance.
property.name: Voltage Output Scaling

property.brief: Enable Power Voltage Detector.
property.name: Enable Power Voltage Detector

property.brief: Power Voltage Detector Level.
property.name: Power Voltage Detector Level

group.name: DMA Settings
group.description: DMA settings for the various peripherals. Note that peripherals can share DMA streams but the drivers cannot be activated at the same time. DMA conflicts are runtime errors and are catched by an assertion.

property.brief: Stream associated to the ADC1 peripheral.
property.name: ADC1 Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the ADC2 peripheral.
property.name: ADC2 Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the ADC3 peripheral.
property.name: ADC3 Stream

property.brief: DMA priority of the ADC1 DMA stream.
property.name: ADC1 Stream Priority

property.brief: DMA priority of the ADC2 DMA stream.
property.name: ADC2 Stream Priority

property.brief: DMA priority of the ADC3 DMA stream.
property.name: ADC3 Stream Priority

property.brief: Function to be invoked in case of a DMA fault, note that a DMA fault is a serious hardware condition and is best handle with a system stop or reset.
property.name: ADC DMAs Error Hook

property.brief: Stream associated to the I2C1 (RX) peripheral.
property.name: I2C1 RX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the I2C1 (TX) peripheral.
property.name: I2C1 TX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the I2C2 (RX) peripheral.
property.name: I2C2 RX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the I2C2 (TX) peripheral.
property.name: I2C2 TX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the I2C3 (RX) peripheral.
property.name: I2C3 RX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the I2C3 (TX) peripheral.
property.name: I2C3 TX Stream

property.brief: DMA priority of the I2C1 RX/TX DMA streams.
property.name: I2C1 Streams Priority

property.brief: DMA priority of the I2C2 RX/TX DMA streams.
property.name: I2C2 Streams Priority

property.brief: DMA priority of the I2C3 RX/TX DMA streams.
property.name: I2C3 Streams Priority

property.brief: Function to be invoked in case of a DMA fault, note that a DMA fault is a serious hardware condition and is best handle with a system stop or reset.
property.name: I2C DMAs Error Hook

property.brief: Stream associated to the SDIO peripheral.
property.name: SDIO Stream

property.brief: DMA priority of the SDIO DMA stream.
property.name: SDIO Stream Priority

property.brief: Function to be invoked in case of a DMA fault, note that a DMA fault is a serious hardware condition and is best handle with a system stop or reset.
property.name: SDIO DMAs Error Hook

property.brief: Stream associated to the SPI1 (RX) peripheral.
property.name: SPI1 RX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the SPI1 (TX) peripheral.
property.name: SPI1 TX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the SPI2 (RX) peripheral.
property.name: SPI2 RX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the SPI2 (TX) peripheral.
property.name: SPI2 TX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the SPI3 (RX) peripheral.
property.name: SPI3 RX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the SPI3 (TX) peripheral.
property.name: SPI3 TX Stream

property.brief: DMA priority of the SPI1 RX/TX DMA streams.
property.name: SPI1 Streams Priority

property.brief: DMA priority of the SPI2 RX/TX DMA streams.
property.name: SPI2 Streams Priority

property.brief: DMA priority of the SPI3 RX/TX DMA streams.
property.name: SPI3 Streams Priority

property.brief: Function to be invoked in case of a DMA fault, note that a DMA fault is a serious hardware condition and is best handle with a system stop or reset.
property.name: SPI DMAs Error Hook

property.brief: Stream associated to the USART1 (RX) peripheral.
property.name: USART1 RX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the USART1 (TX) peripheral.
property.name: USART1 TX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the USART2 (RX) peripheral.
property.name: USART2 RX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the USART2 (TX) peripheral.
property.name: USART2 TX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the USART3 (RX) peripheral.
property.name: USART3 RX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the USART3 (TX) peripheral.
property.name: USART3 TX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the USART6 (RX) peripheral.
property.name: USART6 RX Stream

property.brief: Stream associated to the USART6 (TX) peripheral.
property.name: USART6 TX Stream

property.brief: DMA priority of the USART1 RX/TX DMA streams.
property.name: USART1 Streams Priority

property.brief: DMA priority of the USART2 RX/TX DMA streams.
property.name: USART2 Streams Priority

property.brief: DMA priority of the USART3 RX/TX DMA streams.
property.name: USART3 Streams Priority

property.brief: DMA priority of the USART6 RX/TX DMA streams.
property.name: USART6 Streams Priority

property.brief: Function to be invoked in case of a DMA fault, note that a DMA fault is a serious hardware condition and is best handle with a system stop or reset.
property.name: USART DMAs Error Hook

group.name: IRQ Settings
group.description: ISR priorities. By default, allowed priorities range from 2 (highest) to 15 (lowest). Priorities 0 and 1 are reserved to Fast Interrupts and cannot be used by the HAL drivers. Note that the number of level reserved for Fast Interrupts can change if port settings are changed.

property.brief: Priority of the ADC shared IRQ.
property.name: ADC Shared IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the ADC1 DMA IRQ.
property.name: ADC1 DMA IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the ADC2 DMA IRQ.
property.name: ADC2 DMA IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the ADC3 DMA IRQ.
property.name: ADC3 DMA IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the CAN1 IRQ.
property.name: CAN1 IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the CAN2 IRQ.
property.name: CAN2 IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the ETH IRQ.
property.name: ETH IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the EXTI0 IRQ.
property.name: EXTI0 IRQ Priority

property.name: EXTI1 IRQ Priority

property.name: EXTI2 IRQ Priority

property.name: EXTI3 IRQ Priority

property.name: EXTI4 IRQ Priority

property.name: EXTI5-9 IRQ Priority

property.name: EXTI10-15 IRQ Priority

property.name: EXTI16 IRQ Priority

property.name: EXTI17 IRQ Priority

property.name: EXTI18 IRQ Priority

property.name: EXTI19 IRQ Priority

property.name: EXTI20 IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the EXTI21 IRQ.
property.name: EXTI21 IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the EXTI22 IRQ.
property.name: EXTI22 IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the TIM1 IRQ.
property.name: TIM1 IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the TIM2 IRQ.
property.name: TIM2 IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the TIM3 IRQ.
property.name: TIM3 IRQ Priority

property.name: TIM4 IRQ Priority

property.name: TIM5 IRQ Priority

property.name: TIM8 IRQ Priority

property.name: I2C1 IRQ Priority

property.name: I2C2 IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the I2C3 IRQ.
property.name: I2C3 IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the OTGFS IRQ.
property.name: OTGFS IRQ Priority

property.brief: Priority of the OTGHS IRQ.
property.name: OTGHS IRQ Priority

property.name: SPI1 IRQ Priority

group.name: ADC Settings
group.description: Settings related to the ADC units. Note that the ADC driver is enabled in the generic HAL component.

property.brief: Clock divider shared among all ADC units.
property.name: ADC Clock Divider

property.brief: Enables the use of ADC1 through the HAL ADC driver.
property.name: Use ADC1

property.brief: Enables the use of ADC2 through the HAL ADC driver.
property.name: Use ADC2

property.brief: Enables the use of ADC3 through the HAL ADC driver.
property.name: Use ADC3

group.name: CAN Settings
group.description: Settings related to the CAN units. Note that the CAN driver is enabled in the generic HAL component.

property.brief: Enables the use of CAN1 through the HAL CAN driver.
property.name: Use CAN1

property.brief: Enables the use of CAN2 through the HAL CAN driver.
property.name: Use CAN2

group.name: I2C Settings
group.description: Settings related to the I2C units. Note that the I2C driver is enabled in the generic HAL component.

property.brief: Enables the use of I2C1 through the HAL I2C driver.
property.name: Use I2C1

property.brief: Enables the use of I2C2 through the HAL I2C driver.
property.name: Use I2C2

property.brief: Enables the use of I2C3 through the HAL I2C driver.
property.name: Use I2C3

group.name: MAC Settings
group.description: Settings related to the MAC unit. Note that the MAC driver is enabled in the generic HAL component.

property.brief: Number of transmit buffers large enough to contain a full frame.
property.name: Transmit Buffers

property.brief: Number of receive buffers large enough to contain a full frame.
property.name: Receive Buffers

property.brief: Timeout in searching the PHY during initialization. Zero means single attempt.
property.name: PHY Search Timeout

property.brief: If enabled then the MAC driver is allowed to change the PHY state.
property.name: Enable PHY state change

property.brief: Checksum Offload mode.
property.name: Checksum Offload

group.name: OTG Settings
group.description: Settings related to the OTG units. Note that the USB driver is enabled in the generic HAL component.

property.brief: Enables the use of OTG-FS through the HAL USB driver.
property.name: Use OTG-FS

property.brief: Enables the use of OTG-HS through the HAL USB driver.
property.name: Use OTG-HS

property.brief: Size of the shared RX FIFO, higher values may improve performance depending on application.
property.name: OTG-FS RX FIFO Size

property.brief: Size of the shared RX FIFO, higher values may improve performance depending on application.
property.name: OTG-HS RX FIFO Size

group.name: SPI Settings
group.description: Settings related to the SPI units. Note that the SPI driver is enabled in the generic HAL component.

property.brief: Enables the use of SPI1 through the HAL SPI driver.
property.name: Use SPI1

property.brief: Enables the use of SPI2 through the HAL SPI driver.
property.name: Use SPI2

property.brief: Enables the use of SPI3 through the HAL SPI driver.
property.name: Use SPI3

group.name: TIM Settings
group.description: Timer peripherals are shared between the GPT, ICU and PWM drivers. Here you can assign each time to a driver or keep them reserved/unused.

property.brief: Enables the advanced PWM features on TIM1/TIM8 when assigned to the PWM driver.
property.name: Advanced PWM Mode

property.brief: Driver owning the TIM1 timer.
property.name: TIM1 Assignment

property.brief: Driver owning the TIM2 timer.
property.name: TIM2 Assignment

property.brief: Driver owning the TIM3 timer.
property.name: TIM3 Assignment

property.brief: Driver owning the TIM4 timer.
property.name: TIM4 Assignment

property.brief: Driver owning the TIM5 timer.
property.name: TIM5 Assignment

property.brief: Driver owning the TIM8 timer.
property.name: TIM8 Assignment

group.name: USART Settings
group.description: USART/UART peripherals are shared between the Serial and UART drivers. Here you can assign each time to a driver or keep them reserved/unused.

property.brief: Driver owning the USART1.
property.name: USART1 Assignment

property.brief: Driver owning the USART2.
property.name: USART2 Assignment

property.brief: Driver owning the USART3.
property.name: USART3 Assignment

property.brief: Driver owning the UART4.
property.name: UART4 Assignment

property.brief: Driver owning the UART5.
property.name: UART5 Assignment

property.brief: Driver owning the USART6.
property.name: USART6 Assignment
